Salary Region 2: 26 USDCompany DescriptionIt started with a simple idea: what if surgery could be less invasive and recovery less painful? Nearly 30 years later, that question still fuels everything we do at Intuitive. As a global leader in robotic-assisted surgery and minimally invasive care, our technologies—like the da Vinci surgical system and Ion—have transformed how care is delivered for millions of patients worldwide.We’re a team of engineers, clinicians, and innovators united by one purpose: to make surgery smarter, safer, and more human. Every day, our work helps care teams perform with greater precision and patients recover faster, improving outcomes around the world.The problems we solve demand creativity, rigor, and collaboration. The work is challenging, but deeply meaningful—because every improvement we make has the potential to change a life.If you’re ready to contribute to something bigger than yourself and help transform the future of healthcare, you’ll find your purpose here.Job DescriptionPrimary Function of Position The intern candidate will be responsible for exploring / process mapping / developing / researching / configuring applications and solutions for Intuitive product development. A team member who can work in close supervision with an engineering application developer in the IT Engineering team and with engineers in business teams. Ability to technically comprehend the end-to-end product development process, application development process and be able to develop and map processes / web / AI applications. Participate or run discussions with engineers pertaining to process development as it relates to tools used for design and quality. Achieve Project priorities, by designing, implementing, testing, and helping engineering applications. Coordinate unit, system and integration level test plans, execution, and documentation of results.Essential Job Duties Develop and perform process mapping of end-to-end product developmentComprehend requirements for developing applications from team membersDevelop a prototype AI application for an engineering process workflow automationIncorporate feedback and iterate the app development to refine the solutionShow case the solution to business team and obtain feedbackQualificationsRequired Skills and ExperienceDesign Engineering Applications and Process Knowledge, Business Process Automation, Software development expertise in AI solutions.Process mapping skills, understanding the distinct stages of product development.Programming language skills – Python, Java, XML, XSD, XSLT, AI/ML Development, GenAI, LLMs, Agentic AIExperience in developing web/AI apps.Must be a good analytical person.Must be able to learn rapidly, adjust easily to change, and work on varying assignments.University Hiring Program Eligibility Requirements:University Enrollment: Must be currently enrolled in and returning to an accredited degree-seeking academic program after the internship.Internship Work Period: Must be available to work full-time (approximately 40 hours per week) during a 10–12-week period starting May or June. Specific start dates are shared during the recruiting process.Required Education and Training Current enrollment in a Mechanical Engineering, Industrial Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science, AI or in any engineering discipline at the master’s level with a Masters degree in engineeringTraining in programming and development as part of the course workPreferred Skills and Experience Use of SolidWorks, Windchill, Creo, and any engineering design applicationsUse of tools for process mappingDeveloping applications in AI/ML and/or Analytics spaceExposure to PLM Applications like Agile will be helpfulAdditional InformationDue to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19.
